item.title: Things to Do After New OpenBSD Install
item.description: So you have installed OpenBSD as main OS. Most of the things will work out of the box. But still you have to configure some things. Lock screen on suspend/hibernate/resume Login as root and create /etc/apm directory if it isn’t there already. mkdir /etc/apm echo "pkill -USR1 xidle" > /etc/apm/suspend echo "pkill -USR1 xidle" > /etc/apm/resume echo "pkill -USR1 xidle" > /etc/apm/hibernate chmod +x /etc/apm/suspend chmod +x /etc/apm/hibernate chmod +x /etc/apm/resume On lid closure, machines mostly get suspended.
